FacilityName: Island Equipment Company Gas Manufacturing Plant

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES
Island Equipment Company is located in Guam. The facility stores and distributed chlorine and sulfur dioxide and employs approximately 20 persons at this location. 
Island Equipment Company has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and safety.  Island Equipment Company's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substance.
 
STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
A maximum of 27,920 lbs of sulfur dioxide and 27,920 lbs of chlorine are stored at the facility.  The substances are not used for any processes and no maintenance is performed on the cylinders while on site.

HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY/OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS
Worst-Case Release Scenario Results Summary:
Scenario Description: Per the EPA Regulations, one worst-case release scenario has been defined for each of the covered substances.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.  

Alternative Release Scenario Results Summary:
Scenario Description: Per the EPA Regulations, one alternative-case release scenario has been defined each of the covered substances.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.  

Risk Considerations:
Although the storage and distribution of chlorine and sulfur dioxide has inherent potential risks, and worst-case release scenarios can potentially reach the community; Island Equipment Company has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs to make the worst-case type of event non-credible.  In addition to the safety practices of the company and facility personnel to make this worst-case event non-credible, it should also be recognized that there are inherent analysis assumptions that make the results of the atmospheric dispersion analysis appear worse than what would actually be expected

during such an event (e.g., In the event of a release, sudden rupture and flashing of ammonia would be highly turbulent. Turbulence causes entrainment of air and the released vapor dilutes much more quickly than is shown in the model).

The history of Island Equipment Company (i.e., no RMP-applicable chlorine or sulfur dioxide releases in the last five years) reflects the adequacy of the design and diligence of the facility staff in safely storing chlorine and sulfur dioxide.
 
RISK MANAGEMENT PREVENTION PROGRAM
As part of the implementation of the RMP Program 3, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Island Equipment Company to manage safety issues associated with the storage and distribution of chlorine and sulfur dioxide. Prevention Program 3 elements include:
 
A?68.65    Process Safety Information (PSI) 
A?68.67    Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
A?68.69          Operating Procedures (OP)
A?68.71    Training (TRN)
A?68.73    Mechanical Integrity (MI)
A?68.75    Management of Change (MOC)
A?68.77    Pre-Startup Review (PSSR)
A?68.79    Compliance Audits (CA)
A?68.81    Incident Investigation (II)
A?68.83    Employee Participation (EP)
A?68.85    Hot Work Permit (HWP)
A?68.87    Contractors (CO)
A?68.90    Emergency Planning & Response (EP&R)

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no RMP-applicable releases of ammonia at the facility in at least the past five (5) years.  

FLAMMABLES: WORST CASE
The use of flammable materials at Island Equipment Company facility is not encompassed by either the federal or state RMP requirements.  Therefore, this section is not applicable. 

FLAMMABLES: ALTERNATIVE RELEASE
The use of flammable materials at Island Equipment Company facility is not encompassed by either the federal or state RMP requirements.  Therefore, this section is not applicable.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
